title: Sautéed Potatoes with Garlic, Chilies, and Cilantro (Batata Harra)
ingredients: 1 or 2 chilies, chopped; or, a pinch of chili flakes
instructions: Boil the potatoes in salted water until they are tender.  Remove them from the heat source, drain the water, and allow them to cool so that you can handle them.  Peel the potatoes and cut them into quarters.

In a skillet, over medium heat, add the olive oil and allow it to get hot.  Add the garlic, the chilies, and the potatoes and sauté.  Turn the potatoes over and continue sautéing until the potatoes are crisp and golden.  Season with salt to you taste.
When the potatoes are golden and crisp remove the skillet from the heat.  Off the heat, add the cilantro and stir to mix.  Turn them out into a serving dish and serve hot.
